benchmark_details.name: A4Bench (Affordance Benchmark for MLLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: A4Bench is a novel benchmark designed to evaluate the affordance perception abilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) across two dimensions: Constitutive Affordance and Transformative Affordance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically assess the affordance perception capabilities of MLLMs across two critical dimensions: constitutive affordance and transformative affordance.

data.source: A4Bench consists of 2,000 multimodal question-answer pairs, covering both Constitutive Affordance (1,282 pairs) and Transformative Affordance (718 pairs).
data.annotation: Questions were developed by a team of 60 human annotators categorized by expertise, followed by rigorous review for accuracy and clarity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the degree of match between MLLM responses and correct answers.
methodology.interpretation: A higher exact match accuracy indicates better performance in understanding affordance perception.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance reaches 85.34% exact match accuracy, while the best MLLM achieved 18.05%.
methodology.validation: Models were tested in a zero-shot setting using a randomized question format to ensure fair evaluation.
